question: When the Indian Muslim League was inducted into the interim government in 1946, which of the following portfolio Liyaqat Ali Khan was assigned?
explanation:
Nawabzada Liaquat Ali Khan was an Indian Muslim politician and a leading member of the All India Muslim League. He played an influential role in the partition of India and the creation of Pakistan. He was closely involved in the negotiations over the form of independence to be granted to India after World War II.
When the Indian political leadership asked the Muslim League to send its nominees for representation in the interim government, Liaquat Ali was asked to lead the League group in the Union Cabinet. He was assigned the finance portfolio by the first Indian Prime Minister Pandit Jawahar Lal Nehru.
